DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT TO THE STATE OF OREGON'S UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP.ACTIVITIES:FOR STATES, LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS MAY BE USED TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT   9003, WHICH NOTABLY INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING: (1) ADMINISTERING THE LUST COOPERATIVE ACTIVE PROGRAM; (2) OVERSEEING AND ENFORCE CORRECTIVE ACTION BY OWNERS OR OPERATORS; (3) INVESTIGATING SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES; (4) CLEANING UP RELEASES WHEN UST OWNERS OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING OR UNABLE TO PERFORM THE CORRECTIVE ACTION; (5) TAKING THE NECESSARY PROMPT ACTIONS TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; AND (6) PURSUING COST RECOVERY ACTIONS FOR LUST TRUST FUND (LTF) EXPENDITURES, WHEN NECESSARY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: (1) DEVELOPING GUIDANCE AND DISSEMINATING REGULATORY AND TECHNICAL INFORMATION; (2) RECOVERING LUST TRUST FUND MONIES; (3) CLEANING UP LUST SITES; AND (4) PREPARING REPORTS AND JOINT EVALUATIONS OF PERFORMANCE.  THE PRIMARY DELIVERABLE IS THE STATE CLEANUP DATA THAT IS ENTERED INTO EPA'S LUST4 DATABASE SYSTEM.  THE PRIMARY OUTCOME IS THE CLEANUP OF OPEN LUST SITES, WHICH WILL REDUCE THE SIZE OF THE LUST BACKLOG.  THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS FOR A PUBLIC PURPOSE, AND THE PRIMARY, DIRECT BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM WITH THE INDIRECT BENEFICIARIES BEING THE STATE'S RESIDENTS.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF OREGON IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP.

THE PROJECT SUPPORTS THE STATE'S CONTAMINATED SITES CLEANUP EFFORTS FROM LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (LUST). ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 1) DEVELOPING GUIDANCE AND DISSEMINATING INFORMATION TO TANK OWNERS, RESPONSIBLE PARTIES AND CONSULTANTS; 2) RECOVER EXPENDED FEDERAL DOLLARS AND DETERMINE RESPONSIBLE PARTIES' ABILITY-TO-PAY FOR CLEANUP; 3) INVESTIGATING PETROLEUM RELEASES REPORTED, PROVIDING OVERSIGHT AND TAKING NECESSARY ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS TO COMPEL SITE CLEANUP; 4) PROVIDE EPA REPORTS AND CONDUCT JOINT EVALUATION OF PERFORMANCE; AND 5) PROVIDE REQUIRED CORE TRAINING FOR LUST STAFF.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF NEBRASKA IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP. SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ITS LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM, WHICH INCLUDES ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND ENFORCEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES.

THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE LUST CORRECTIVE PROGRAM ARE TO INVESTIGATE SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES AND TO PERFORM CORRECTIVE ACTION ON THESE RELEASES.    
ACTIVITIES:MAJOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INVESTIGATING SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES, OVERSEEING AND ENFORCING CORRECTIVE ACTION BY OWNERS OR OPERATORS, AND PERFORMING DIRECT CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES WHEN THOSE OWNERS OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, OR UNABLE TO PERFORM THOSE ACTIVITIES THEMSELVES. THE ASSISTANCE AWARD'S PURPOSE IS TO ASSIST THE STATE'S LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM WITH THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: STORAGE TANK SECTION MANAGEMENT, LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK DATA MANAGEMENT, ADMINISTRATION OF LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK ACTIVITIES, STATE-LEAD INVESTIGATION AND CLEANUP, AND PROMOTE INNOVATIVE CORRECTIVE ACTION TECHNOLOGIES.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS THE STATE CLEANUP DATA THAT IS ENTERED INTO THE LUST4 SYSTEM. THE PRIMARY OUTCOME IS A REDUCTION IN THE BACKLOG OF UST RELEASES FOR WHICH CLEANUPS HAVE NOT YET BEEN COMPLETED. THE OUTCOMES WILL BE ADVANCING THE INVESTIGATION AND CLOSURE OF TECHNICALLY CHALLENGING LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE SITES AND REDUCING THEIR THREAT TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE'S LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM AND THE PUBLIC HEALTH/ENVIRONMENT THEY ARE ASSIGNED TO PROTECT. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS. THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE UTE INDIAN TRIBE TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROGRAM FOR LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN ADDRESSING LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS AND ABANDONED SITES ACROSS THEIR LANDS. THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE MONTANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP. SPECIFICALLY, MONTANA DEQ'S PETROLEUM TANK CLEANUP SECTION (PTCS) HAS IDENTIFIED FOUR MAJOR GOALS ESSENTIAL TO HELPING US MEET DEQ'S MISSION TO PROTECT, SUSTAIN, AND IMPROVE A CLEAN AND HEALTHFUL ENVIRONMENT TO BENEFIT PRESENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS: 1. DRIVE PETROLEUM RELEASES TO A NEW MILESTONE OF PETROLEUM CLEANUP TO CONTINUE MOVING SITES TOWARDS CLOSURE. 2. IMPLEMENT DATABASE IMPROVEMENTS TO BUILD EFFICIENCY IN CAPTURE AND RETRIEVAL OF PTCS INFORMATION. 3. IMPLEMENT TOOLS TO SUPPORT SPECIFIC BUSINESS PROCESS CHANGES TO IMPROVE EFFICIENCY, REDUCE REDUNDANCY, AND BETTER MANAGE RESOURCES. 4. UTILIZE ALL AVAILABLE FUNDING SOURCES TO MAXIMIZE THE NUMBER OF SITES ADDRESSED.


ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE INITIATIVE:
PTCS WILL CONTINUE TO IDENTIFY AND IMPLEMENT STEPS TO INTEGRATE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE FACTORS INTO LUST PROGRAMMATIC PLANNING AND ACTIVITIES, CONSISTENT WITH STATE AND FEDERAL ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE GUIDANCE. THIS WILL INCLUDE THE EVALUATION OF CUMULATIVE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS ON DISPROPORTIONATELY IMPACTED COMMUNITIES. 

DURING FFY 2024 PTCS WILL COMPLETE COMPLIANCE MONITORING TO MOVE TWO RELEASES TO CLOSURE WHICH EXCEED 80% FOR POLLUTION SOURCES, SOCIOECONOMIC INDICATORS, HEALTH DISPARITIES, AND CRITICAL SERVICE GAPS AS IDENTIFIED ON THE EJSCREEN MAPPING TOOL. THE PROPERTY OWNERS ALSO LACK THE ABILITY TO PAY FOR REQUIRED ENVIRONMENTAL WORK. 
JUSTICE40 REPORTING:
MONTANA WILL REPORT LOCATION DATA FOR ALL NEW LUST CLEANUPS COMPLETED IN LUST4 AT MID-YEAR AND END-OF-YEAR.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE FURTHER ADDITIONAL SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR DISASTER RELIEF REQUIREMENTS ACT, 2018 OF THE BIPARTISAN BUDGET ACT OF 2018 (H.R. 1892, PUBLIC LAW NO.115-123) TO  ASSIST PUERTO RICO IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING A LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PROGRAM BY SUPPORTING ACTIVITIES THAT MAKE PROGRESS IN INVESTIGATING AND CLEANING-UP PETROLEUM IN RESPONSE TO HURRICANES IRMA AND MARIA.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING UNDER THE FURTHER ADDITIONAL SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR DISASTER RELIEF REQUIREMENTS ACT, 2018 OF THE BIPARTISAN BUDGET ACT OF 2018 (H.R. 1892, PUBLIC LAW NO.115-123) TO U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS TO ASSIST IN MANAGING THE CLEANUP OF  LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) DUE TO THE EFFECTS OF HURRICANES IRMA AND MARIA. THE PROJECT'S GOAL IS TO PROTECT THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS' GROUNDWATER SUPPLIES.  LUSTS CAN CAUSE PETROLEUM AND OTHER CHEMICALS TO CONTAMINATE WATER SUPPLIES.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT TO THE SENECA NATION OF INDIANS  TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROGRAM TO MANAGE UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS ON TRIBAL LANDS AND TO PREVENT AND REMEDIATE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS.  THESE OBJECTIVES PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT BY PREVENTING AND REMEDIATING PETROLEUM AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE RELEASES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE CONFEDERATED SALISH AND KOOTENAI TRIBES TO IMPLEMENT ITS PROGRAM FOR LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN ADDRESSING LEAKING USTS AND ABANDONED SITES ACROSS THEIR LANDS. THESE ACTIONS HELP PREVENT RELEASES OF PETROLEUM AND OTHER HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES INTO THE ENVIRONMENT. ACTIVITIES:1. REVIEW, MAINTAIN, AND UPDATE LUST INVENTORY DATABASE. 
2. COMPLETE TRAINING
3. CONDUCT FIELD OVERSIGHT ACTIVITIES
4. CONTINUE ABANDONED TANK SURVEY
5. COMPLETE FISCAL AND PROGRAM REPORTING. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:1. TRIBE DEVELOPS, ADMINISTERS, AND MAINTAINS DATABASE OF LUST CLEANUP SITES ON TRIBAL LAND. 
2. TRIBE WILL UNDERSTAND TECHNICAL AND REGULATORY KNOWLEDGE OF UST PROGRAM TO IMPROVE WORK PERFORMANCE. TRAININGS WILL UPDATE AND UPDATE SKILLS AND SUPPORT TRIBAL PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT. 
3. SUPPORT THE EPA WITH CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES THAT ADDRESS RELEASES FROM USTS CONTAINING PETROLEUM. 
4. TRIBE ACQUIRES ADDITIONAL RECORDS OF FORMER UST FACILITIES ON TRIBAL LAND AND INCREASES AWARENESS OF POTENTIAL LUST CLEANUP SITES. 
5. INTERACTION AND OPEN COMMUNICATION WITH THE EPA TO REPORT ON TRIBE'S ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM ACTIVITIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS WORK PLAN WILL PROVIDE FUNDING OF ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY WDNR IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS SITES WITHIN THE STATE OF WISCONSIN.  THE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO DIRECT THE CLEANUP OF PROPERTIES WHERE PETROLEUM HAS LEAKED FROM STATE AND FEDERALLY REGULATED UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS.ACTIVITIES:ADMINISTRATION OF THE LUST TRUST FUND CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM OVERSIGHT AND ENFORCEMENT OF CORRECTIVE ACTIONS TAKEN BY OWNERS AND OPERATORS INVESTIGATION OF SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES CLEANUP OF RELEASES WHEN UST OWNER OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, AND UNABLE TO PERFORM CORRECTIVE ACTION (STATE LEAD ACTIONS) PROMPT ACTION TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT PURSUIT OF COST RECOVERY OF LUST TRUST FUND. STATES CAN USE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT MONEY TO PAY FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, SITE CORRECTIVE ACTION AND ENFORCEMENT AND ASSOCIATED INDIRECT COSTS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:COMPONENT 1: DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN STATE LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM AND STAFF COMPONENT 2: ENSURE COMPLIANCE OF LUST STATE STATUTES AND REGULATIONS COMPONENT 3: IMPLEMENT CORRECTIVE ACTION FOR LUST SITES COMPONENT 4: RECOVER LUST TRUST FUND CLEANUP COSTS FROM RESPONSIBLE PARTIES COMPONENT 5: REPORT ON GRANT PERFORMANCE COMPONENT 6: INCORPORATE EJ ACTIVITIES INTO THE STATE PROGRAM THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF WISCONSIN.

DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT TO THE STATE OF WASHINGTON' S UST PROGRAM IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP. ACTIVITIES:FOR STATES, LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS MAY BE USED TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT   9003, WHICH NOTABLY INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING: (1) ADMINISTERING THE LUST COOPERATIVE ACTIVE PROGRAM; (2) OVERSEEING AND ENFORCE CORRECTIVE ACTION BY OWNERS OR OPERATORS; (3) INVESTIGATING SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES; (4) CLEANING UP RELEASES WHEN UST OWNERS OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING OR UNABLE TO PERFORM THE CORRECTIVE ACTION; (5) TAKING THE NECESSARY PROMPT ACTIONS TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; AND (6) PURSUING COST RECOVERY ACTIONS FOR LUST TRUST FUND (LTF) EXPENDITURES, WHEN NECESSARY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: (1) THE CLEANUP OF LUST SITES THROUGH THE VOLUNTARY CLEANUP PROGRAM (VCP); (2) PERIODIC REPORTING TO THE EPA ON THE PROGRESS OF LUST CLEANUPS; AND (3) THE USE OF ENFORCEMENT TO PUSH LUST SITES TO A CLEANUP RESOLUTION.  THE GOAL IS TO OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF RELEASES FROM USTS CONTAINING PETROLEUM OR OTHER HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCES TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF ENVIRONMENTALLY AND ECONOMICALLY SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITIES.  THE PRIMARY DELIVERABLE IS THE STATE CLEANUP DATA THAT IS ENTERED INTO EPA'S LUST4 DATABASE SYSTEM.  THE PRIMARY OUTCOME IS THE CLEANUP OF OPEN LUST SITES, WHICH WILL REDUCE THE SIZE OF THE LUST BACKLOG.  THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS FOR A PUBLIC PURPOSE, AND THE PRIMARY, DIRECT BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM WITH THE INDIRECT BENEFICIARIES BEING THE STATE'S RESIDENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT TO THE STATE OF IDAHO'S UST PROGRAM IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP.ACTIVITIES:FOR STATES, LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS MAY BE USED TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT   9003, WHICH NOTABLY INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING: (1) ADMINISTERING THE LUST COOPERATIVE ACTIVE PROGRAM; (2) OVERSEEING AND ENFORCE CORRECTIVE ACTION BY OWNERS OR OPERATORS; (3) INVESTIGATING SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES; (4) CLEANING UP RELEASES WHEN UST OWNERS OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING OR UNABLE TO PERFORM THE CORRECTIVE ACTION; (5) TAKING THE NECESSARY PROMPT ACTIONS TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; AND (6) PURSUING COST RECOVERY ACTIONS FOR LUST TRUST FUND (LTF) EXPENDITURES, WHEN NECESSARY.

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: (1)  COMPILE AND SUBMIT REPORTS TO EPA. INCLUDES: 1] ACTIVE LUST SITES REPORT; 2] CLOSED LUST SITES REPORT; 3] NEW LUST, (2) STAFF WILL ATTEND AND TRACK TANK CLOSURE ACTIVITY, (3)  INITIATE ENFORCEMENT FOR SITES WITH NEW RELEASES; ENTER INTO AND TRACK EXISTING CONSENT ORDERS; PROVIDE SITE CLOSURE LETTERS (CLEANUP COMPLETE), (4)  PROVIDE LUST INFORMATION, RECORDS, AND REPORTS TO USER GROUPS (E.G. OTHER AGENCIES, GENERAL PUBLIC, REGULATED COMMUNITY, FINANCIAL AND PROPERTY TRANSFER INSTITUTIONS, INTEREST GROUPS, LEGISLATURE) CONCERNING RELEASES, CLOSURES, SITE ASSESSMENTS, CLEANUP, AND ALL OTHER LUST ISSUES.  THE PRIMARY DELIVERABLE IS THE STATE CLEANUP DATA THAT IS ENTERED INTO EPA'S LUST4 DATABASE SYSTEM.  THE PRIMARY OUTCOME IS THE CLEANUP OF OPEN LUST SITES, WHICH WILL REDUCE THE SIZE OF THE LUST BACKLOG.  THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS FOR A PUBLIC PURPOSE, AND THE PRIMARY, DIRECT BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM WITH THE INDIRECT BENEFICIARIES BEING THE STATE'S RESIDENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $547,000 TO MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP. ACTIVITIES PERFORMED INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO IMPLEMENTING CORRECTIVE ACTIONS TO DETERMINE SOURCE AND EXTENT OF CONTAMINATION AT UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) SITES.  ANOTHER ACTIVITY IS MS WILL OVERSEE AND ENFORCE RESPONSIBLE PARTY (RP) CLEANUPS, TO RESPOND TO PETROLEUM RELEASES FROM USTS WHERE OWNERS AND OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, OR UNABLE TO TAKE CORRECTIVE ACTION THEMSELVES OR WHEN PROMPT ACTION IS REQUIRED TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT, AND TO RECOVER COSTS FROM RP'S WHO ARE UNWILLING TO PAY FOR THE CLEANUPS.  INVESTIGATIVE REPORTS ARE REVIEWED TO DETERMINE THE NECESSITY FOR ADDITIONAL INVESTIGATION AND CLEANUP.  THE RECIPIENT WILL WORK TOWARDS REDUCING ITS BACKLOG OF LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK CLEANUPS BY 100, WHICH WILL LEAD TO THE PROTECTION OF THE ENVIRONMENT AND SUBSEQUENTLY THE PUBLIC. EXPECTED DELIVERABLES/OUTCOMES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO CONTROLLING THE RISKS TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AT CONTAMINATED SITES BY MITIGATING THE IMPACTS OF ACCIDENTAL OR INTENTIONAL RELEASES, AND BY CLEANING UP, STABILIZING OR OTHER ACTION, AND RESTORING CONTAMINATED SITES TO APPROPRIATE LEVELS TO MAKE LAND READY FOR REUSE.  THE PRIMARY AND DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI'S RESIDENTS.ACTIVITIES:.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:.

DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT TO THE STATE OF WASHINGTON'S UST PROGRAM IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP. ACTIVITIES:FOR STATES, LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FUNDS MAY BE USED TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RECOVERY ACT   9003, WHICH NOTABLY INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING: (1) ADMINISTERING THE LUST COOPERATIVE ACTIVE PROGRAM; (2) OVERSEEING AND ENFORCE CORRECTIVE ACTION BY OWNERS OR OPERATORS; (3) INVESTIGATING SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES; (4) CLEANING UP RELEASES WHEN UST OWNERS OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING OR UNABLE TO PERFORM THE CORRECTIVE ACTION; (5) TAKING THE NECESSARY PROMPT ACTIONS TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT; AND (6) PURSUING COST RECOVERY ACTIONS FOR LUST TRUST FUND (LTF) EXPENDITURES, WHEN NECESSARY. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE FUNDING FOR LUST CLEANUP, WHICH IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH PROGRAMS SUCH AS (1) THE POLLUTION LIABILITY LOAN AND GRANT PROGRAM, (2) THE COMMERCIAL UST REINSURANCE PROGRAM, AND (3) THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (TAP).  THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS TO OVERSEE THE CLEANUP OF PETROLEUM RELEASES FROM USTS AND TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF ENVIRONMENTALLY AND ECONOMICALLY SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITIES.  THE POLLUTION LIABILITY ASSURANCE AGENCY (PLIA) HAS COMMITTED TO A LONG-TERM OUTCOME OF REDUCING THE LUST BACKLOG BY 50 PERCENT AT THE END OF 2034.  THE PRIMARY DELIVERABLE IS THE STATE CLEANUP DATA THAT IS ENTERED INTO EPA'S LUST4 DATABASE SYSTEM.  THE PRIMARY OUTCOME IS THE CLEANUP OF PEN LUST SITES, WHICH WILL REDUCE THE SIZE OF WASHINGTON'S BACKLOG.  THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS FOR A PUBLIC PURPOSE, AND THE PRIMARY, DIRECT BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM WITH THE INDIRECT BENEFICIARIES BEING THE STATE'S RESIDENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE POLLUTION LIABILITY INSURANCE AGENCY (PLIA) IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP.ACTIVITIES:THE GOAL OF PLIA'S LUST ACTIVITIES IS TO OVERSEE THE CLEAN UP OF RELEASES FROM UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS CONTAINING PETROLEUM AND SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF ENVIRONMENTALLY AND ECONOMICALLY SUSTAINABLE COMMUNITIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:PLIA PLANS TO PRODUCE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS GIVING AN UPDATE ON THE LUST BACKLOG DOCUMENTING STIES CLOSED. IN ADDITION PLIA WILL ALSO ASSIST APPLICANTS CURRENTLY WITHIN THE PROGRAM TO MOVE TOWARDS SITE CLOSURE.  THIS WILL GENERATE TWENTY-ONE SITE OR PROPERTY-SPECIFIC NFA OPINIONS DURING THE FY 2023 GRANT PERIOD FOR SITES WHICH WERE INITIATED THROUGH THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.  SITES INITIATED THROUGH THE PORTFOLIA MANAGEMENT PROCESS WILL CONTRIBUTE SEVEN SITE OR PROPERTY SPECIFIC NO FURTHER ACTION (NFA) OPINIONS DURING THE FY 2023 GRANT PERIOD

THEY WILL INSPECT BETWEEN 20 - 30 LUST CLEANUP SITES, MAINTAIN THE QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN, PROVIDE UPDATES TO THE PLAN, AND WORK WITH EPA REGARDING QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN AUDITS AND ANY EPA REQUESTED REVISIONS. 

THERE WILL BE A FOCUS ON BRINGING LARGE MILITARY BASE LUST SITES INTO COMPLIANCE AND, WHEN POSSIBLE, SEPARATING SMALL FEDERALLY OWNED LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS SITES FROM LARGER FACILITIES/BASES SO THAT THIS PART OF THE FACILITY CAN BE CHARACTERIZED ON ITS OWN WITH THE GOAL OF CLOSING THE LUST PORTION.  CONTINUED MANAGEMENT OF THE INFORMATION ASSOCIATED WITH THE OPEN LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS SITES.

ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A REDUCTION OF THE NUMBER OF OPEN LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS SITES AND REDUCED HUMAN HEALTH AND ENVIRONMENTAL RISKS IN REGIONS OF ALASKA WITH ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONCERNS.

THE PROJECT WILL HELP SUPPORT THE STATE'S EFFORTS TO CLEAN UP CONTAMINATED SITES PRODUCED BY LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 1) OVERSIGHT OF SITE CLEANUP; 2) MANAGE INFORMATION AND RESPOND TO PUBLIC REQUESTS; 3) RECOVER AND REUSE CLEANUP COSTS;  4) MAINTAIN LABORATORY STANDARDS ; 5) INCREASE CLEANUPS AT FEDERAL FACILITIES; AND 6) PROGRAM AND POLICY DEVELOPMENT.

1) DEVELOP GUIDANCE AND DISSEMINATE REQULATORY AND TECHNICAL INFORMATION TO TANK OWNERS, RESPONSIBLE PARTIES (RPS), CONSULTANTS, AND OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES; 2) COST RECOVER EXPENDED FEDERAL DOLLARS FROM RESPONSIBLE PARTIES (RPS), WHERE SPENT, AND DETERMINE RPS ABILITY-TO-PAY FOR THE CLEANUP OF THEIR SITE; 3) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF CLEANUPS COMPLETED BY INVESTIGATING PETROLEUM RELEASES REPORTED, PROVIDING OVERSIGHT, CONDUCT FILE REVIEWS AND TAKING THE NECESSARY ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS TO COMPEL SITE CLEANUP; AND 4) REVIEW THE BACKLOG AND REMOVE SITES THAT SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN PLACED ON THE LUST LIST.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA FOR DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE INVENTORY OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP.  THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS SPECIAL PROJECT IS TO ASSESS FOR ANY POTENTIAL HYDROCARBON IMPACT AT REGULATED PSTD FACILITIES WITH PERMANENTLY OUT OF USE (POU) PETROLEUM STORAGE TANKS TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL LUST SITES; SOME OF WHICH COULD BE LUST TRUST FUND SITES. THE TARGET SITES ARE FACILITIES WITH HISTORICAL TANKS THAT WERE EITHER PERMANENTLY CLOSED OR ABANDONED PRIOR TO ANY REQUIREMENTS FOR SAMPLING TO TAKE PLACE IN CONJUNCTION WITH TANK CLOSURES. THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA WILL PROPERLY ASSESS AND SAMPLE AS MANY ABANDONED POU UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK FACILITIES AS PART OF STATEWIDE CONTRACT SW0136 IN ORDER TO IDENTIFY POTENTIAL LUST SITES.  THIS AWARD IS FOR FISCAL YEAR 2021 - 2023

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE INVENTORY OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP.  THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO WILL PROVIDE INVESTIGATIONS, EMERGENCY RESPONSES, REMEDIATION, RISK ASSESSMENT, ALTERNATIVE WATER SUPPLIES AND RELOCATION OF RESIDENTS AT SITES WHERE THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY IS UNKNOWN, OR UNWILLING, UNABLE TO RESPOND OR EMINENT DANGER TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.  THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS SPECIAL PROJECT IS TO PILOT AN INITIATIVE TO EXPEDITE REMEDIATION/CLEAN UP TO SITES THAT HAVE BEEN IN MONITORED NATURAL ATTENUATION FOR OVER THEN (10) YEARS. THIS AWARD IS FOR FISCAL YEAR 2020 - 2021.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF TEXAS TO IDENTIFY NEW RELEASES OF PETROLEUM FROM USTS CAUSED BY THE EFFECTS OF HURRICANES HARVEY, IRMA, AND MARIA OR EXISTING RELEASES EXACERBATED BY THE EFFECTS OF ONE OF THESE HURRICANES, AND TAKE APPROPRIATE CORRECTIVE ACTIONS AS NECESSARY TO ACHIEVE STATE SPECIFIC CLEANUP REQUIREMENTS.  ACTIVITIES MAY ALSO INCLUDE TANK AND LINE TIGHTNESS TESTS, EXPEDITED SITE ASSESSMENT METHODS OR CONVENTIONAL SITE ASSESSMENT METHODS TO VERIFY RELEASES AND COLLECT DATA TO DETERMINE THE NEED FOR ADDITIONAL ASSESSMENT WORK OR SITE REMEDIATION.

ACTIVITIES MAY ALSO INCLUDE TANK AND LINE TIGHTNESS TESTS, EXPEDITED SITE ASSESSMENT METHODS OR CONVENTIONAL SITE ASSESSMENT METHODS TO VERIFY RELEASES AND COLLECT DATA TO DETERMINE THE NEED FOR ADDITIONAL ASSESSMENT WORK OR SITE REMEDIATION.THIS AWARD IS FOR MULTIPLE FISCAL YEARS 8/23/2017 - 8/22/2024.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO CSKT'S LUST PROGRAM.  SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ITS LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM, WHICH INCLUDES ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND ENFORCEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES.  THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM ARE TO INVESTIGATE SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES AND TO PERFORM CORRECTIVE ACTION ON THESE RELEASES.  
ACTIVITIES:THE MAJOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INVESTIGATING SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES, OVERSEEING AND ENFORCING CORRECTIVE ACTION BY OWNERS OR OPERATORS, AND PERFORMING DIRECT CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES WHEN THOSE OWNERS OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, OR UNABLE TO PERFORM THOSE ACTIVITIES THEMSELVES. THE WORK SHOULD INCLUDE MAINTAINING AND UPDATING AN INVENTORY DATABASE OF LUST SITES, TRAINING, OVERSIGHT OF FIELD ACTIVITIES, COMPLETING AN ABANDONED TANK SURVEY, AND FISCAL/PROGRAM REPORTING.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS THE TRIBAL CLEANUP DATA THAT IS ENTERED INTO THE LUST4 SYSTEM.  THE PRIMARY OUTCOME IS A REDUCTION IN THE TRIBAL INDIAN COUNTRY BACKLOG OF UST RELEASES FOR WHICH CLEANUPS HAVE NOT YET BEEN COMPLETED.  THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARY IS THE TRIBAL CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,408,000 TO THE STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA TO IMPLEMENT CORRECTIVE ACTIONS TO DETERMINE SOURCE AND EXTENT OF CONTAMINATION AT UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (UST) SITES DUE TO THE IMPACTS OF THE 2018 HURRICANES MICHAEL AND FLORENCE.

THIS AGREEMENT APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $83,376 TO ASSIST THE STATE OF FLORIDA IN ADDRESSING LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK CLEANUP ACTIVITIES MADE NECESSARY BY THE IMPACTS OF 2018 HURRICANES FLORENCE AND MICHAEL.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,900,000 TO THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF FLORIDA IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING, AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP.  
ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES PERFORMED INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO IMPLEMENTING CORRECTIVE ACTIONS TO DETERMINE SOURCE AND EXTENT OF CONTAMINATION AT UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) SITES.  ANOTHER ACTIVITY IS FLORIDA WILL OVERSEE AND ENFORCE RESPONSIBLE PARTY (RP) CLEANUPS, TO RESPOND TO PETROLEUM RELEASES FROM USTS WHERE OWNERS AND OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, OR UNABLE TO TAKE CORRECTIVE ACTION THEMSELVES OR WHEN PROMPT ACTION IS REQUIRED TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT, AND TO RECOVER COSTS FROM RP'S WHO ARE UNWILLING TO PAY FOR THE CLEANUPS.  INVESTIGATIVE REPORTS ARE REVIEWED TO DETERMINE THE NECESSITY FOR ADDITIONAL INVESTIGATION AND CLEANUP.  THE RECIPIENT WILL WORK TOWARDS REDUCING ITS BACKLOG OF LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK CLEANUPS BY 550, WHICH WILL LEAD TO THE PROTECTION OF THE ENVIRONMENT AND SUBSEQUENTLY THE PUBLIC.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED DELIVERABLES/OUTCOMES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO CONTROLLING THE RISKS TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AT CONTAMINATED SITES BY MITIGATING THE IMPACTS OF ACCIDENTAL OR INTENTIONAL RELEASES, AND BY CLEANING UP, STABILIZING OR OTHER ACTION, AND RESTORING CONTAMINATED SITES TO APPROPRIATE LEVELS TO MAKE LAND READY FOR REUSE.  THE PRIMARY AND DIRECT BENEFICIARIES ARE THE STATE OF FLORIDA'S RESIDENTS.

THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,900,000 TO THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION TO SUPPORT THE STATE WITH DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT CLEANED UP. FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL REDUCE RISKS TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT AT CONTAMINATED SITES BY REDUCING ITS BACKLOG OF CLEANUPS, MITIGATING THE IMPACTS OF ACCIDENTAL OR INTENTIONAL RELEASES, BY CLEANING UP, STABILIZING OR OTHER ACTION, AND RESTORING CONTAMINATED SITES TO APPROPRIATE LEVELS TO MAKE LAND READY FOR REUSE. FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION WILL OVERSEE AND ENFORCE RESPONSIBLE PARTY CLEANUPS, RESPOND TO PETROLEUM RELEASE WHERE OWNERS AND OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, OR UNABLE TO TAKE CORRECTIVE ACTION THEMSELVES OR WHEN PROMPT ACTION IS REQUIRED TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT, AND TO RECOVER COSTS FROM RESPONSIBLE PARTIES WHO ARE UNWILLING TO PAY FOR THE CLEANUPS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES AN AWARD IN THE AMOUNT OF $2,595,569 TO NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES PERFORMED INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO IMPLEMENTING CORRECTIVE ACTIONS TO DETERMINE SOURCE AND EXTENT OF CONTAMINATION AT UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) SITES. ANOTHER ACTIVITY IS NORTH CAROLINA WILL OVERSEE AND ENFORCE RESPONSIBLE PARTY (RP) CLEANUPS, TO RESPOND TO PETROLEUM RELEASES FROM USTS WHERE OWNERS AND OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, OR UNABLE TO TAKE CORRECTIVE ACTION THEMSELVES OR WHEN PROMPT ACTION IS REQUIRED TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT, AND TO RECOVER COSTS FROM RP'S WHO ARE UNWILLING TO PAY FOR THE CLEANUPS.  INVESTIGATIVE REPORTS ARE REVIEWED TO DETERMINE THE NECESSITY FOR ADDITIONAL INVESTIGATION AND CLEANUP. THE RECIPIENT WILL WORK TOWARDS REDUCING ITS BACKLOG OF LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK CLEANUPS BY 500, WHICH WILL LEAD TO THE PROTECTION OF THE ENVIRONMENT AND SUBSEQUENTLY THE PUBLIC. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF  CONNECTICUT'S LUST PROGRAM. SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ITS LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM, WHICH INCLUDES ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND ENFORCEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES. THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE LUST CORRECTIVE PROGRAM ARE TO INVESTIGATE SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES AND TO PERFORM CORRECTIVE ACTION ON THESE RELEASES.
ACTIVITIES:MAJOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INVESTIGATING SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES, OVERSEEING AND ENFORCING CORRECTIVE ACTION BY OWNERS OR OPERATORS, AND PERFORMING DIRECT CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES WHEN THOSE OWNERS OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, OR UNABLE TO PERFORM THOSE ACTIVITIES THEMSELVES.  THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES; IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LUST PROGRAM; AND SUPPORTING ACTIVITIES IDENTIFYING SITES CONTAMINATED BY PETROLEUM RELEASES FROM UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS, OVERSEEING THE ASSESSMENT AND REMEDIATION OF SOILS AND GROUNDWATER AT THESE LUST SITES, OR TAKING AUTHORIZED CORRECTIVE ACTION TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM THESE RELEASES AND REDUCE THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP. THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FOR AWARDING ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT IN FEDERAL FISCAL YEARS 2023 AND 2024. THIS AWARD IS THE FY23 ALLOCATION. PARTIAL AWARD.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS THE STATE CLEANUP DATA THAT IS ENTERED INTO THE LUST4 SYSTEM. THE PRIMARY OUTCOME IS A REDUCTION IN THE BACKLOG OF UST RELEASES FOR WHICH CLEANUPS HAVE NOT YET BEEN COMPLETED. THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM.

THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO ASSIST THE STATE IN IDENTIFYING SITES CONTAMINATED BY PETROLEUM AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE RELEASES FROM UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (USTS), OVERSEEING THE REMEDIATION OF SOILS AND GROUNDWATER AT THESE SITES, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP. THIS AWARD IS THE FY2019 ALLOCATION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF KANSAS IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP. SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ITS LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM, WHICH INCLUDES ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND ENFORCEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES. THIS AWARD PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING. FURTHER FUNDING MAY BE PROVIDED AT A LATER DATE.
 
ACTIVITIES:MAJOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INVESTIGATING SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES, OVERSEEING AND ENFORCING CORRECTIVE ACTION BY OWNERS OR OPERATORS, AND PERFORMING DIRECT CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES WHEN THOSE OWNERS OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, OR UNABLE TO PERFORM THOSE ACTIVITIES THEMSELVES. THE ASSISTANCE AWARD'S PURPOSE IS TO ASSIST THE STATE'S LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM WITH THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: STORAGE TANK SECTION MANAGEMENT, LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK DATA MANAGEMENT, ADMINISTRATION OF LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK ACTIVITIES, STATE-LEAD INVESTIGATION AND CLEANUP, AND PROMOTE INNOVATIVE CORRECTIVE ACTION TECHNOLOGIES.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE TECHNICAL REPORTS (2) FROM LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK SITE INVESTIGATIONS. THE OUTCOMES WILL BE ADVANCING THE INVESTIGATION AND CLOSURE OF TECHNICALLY CHALLENGING LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE SITES AND REDUCING THEIR THREAT TO PUBLIC HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE'S LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAM AND THE PUBLIC HEALTH/ENVIRONMENT THEY ARE ASSIGNED TO PROTECT. THERE ARE NO SUBRECIPIENTS.
DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAMS, LEAK PROTECTION AND COMPLIANCE.   THIS AWARD PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING. FURTHER FUNDING MAY BE PROVIDED AT A LATER DATE.
DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK PROGRAMS, LEAK PROTECTION AND COMPLIANCE.   THIS AWARD PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING, FULL FUNDING MAY BE PROVIDED AT A LATER DATE.

(POS: ADD SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES FROM THE WORKPLAN HERE.)SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS THE STATE CLEANUP DATA THAT IS ENTERED INTO THE LUST4 SYSTEM. THIS AWARD PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OVERSIGHT, MONITORING AND CLEANUP OF PETROLEUM RELEASES FROM UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (USTS).  IOWA HAS THE AUTHORITY TO MONITOR AND ADMINISTER FUNDS FOR CORRECTIVE ACTIONS USING LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS (LUST) TRUST FUNDS.  THIS AWARD PROVIDES INCREMENTAL FUNDING. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF TEXAS'S LUST PROGRAM. SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ITS LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM, WHICH INCLUDES ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND ENFORCEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES. THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE LUST CORRECTIVE PROGRAM ARE TO INVESTIGATE SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES AND TO PERFORM CORRECTIVE ACTION ON THESE RELEASES.ACTIVITIES:MAJOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INVESTIGATING SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES, OVERSEEING AND ENFORCING CORRECTIVE ACTION BY OWNERS OR OPERATORS, AND PERFORMING DIRECT CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES WHEN THOSE OWNERS OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, OR UNABLE TO PERFORM THOSE ACTIVITIES THEMSELVES. THE PROGRAM ELEMENTS IN THE 2023 LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) CORRECTIVE ACTION GRANTS PROGRAM INCLUDE (1) COORDINATE AND PERFORM ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND STAFF WORK NECESSARY FOR RESPONDING TO RELEASES ACCORDING TO EPA'S GUIDELINES; (2) BE RESPONSIBLE FOR A SPECIFIC NUMBER OF CLEANUPS COMPLETED SUCH THAT THE ACS MEASURES WILL BE MET; (3) OVERSEE ALL UST RELEASES/CLEANUPS WITH THE INTENT OF INCREASING THE PACE AT WHICH THEY ARE INITIATED AND COMPLETED; (4) PROVIDE END-OF-YEAR EVALUATION OF THE STATE'S PERFORMANCE IN ADMINISTERING THE LUST GRANT; (5) WORK TO INTEGRATE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONSIDERATIONS INTO UST/LUST PROGRAMS AND PROGRAMMATIC DECISIONS. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS THE STATE CLEANUP DATA THAT IS ENTERED INTO THE LUST4 SYSTEM. THE PRIMARY OUTCOME IS A REDUCTION IN THE BACKLOG OF UST RELEASES FOR WHICH CLEANUPS HAVE NOT YET BEEN COMPLETED. THE PRIMARY AND DIRECT BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE'S LUST PROGRAM.

THE SPECIFIC PROJECT ACTIVITIES ARE: COORDINATING AND PERFORMING ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND STAFF WORK NECESSARY FOR RESPONDING TO LEAKS, COMPLETING LUST CLEANUPS, AND IMPLEMENTING A COMMON SET OF ENVIRONMENTAL GOALS AND INDICATORS.&NBSPAND

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF TEXAS IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP. DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA ASSISTANCE IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING, AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PROGRAM. WITH A STATE TARGET OF 120 SITE CLEANUPS, THE STATE WILL INCREASE THE PACE OF CLEANING UP EXISTING RELEASES, PROMOTE THE BENEFITS OF INCENTIVE-BASED CLEAN-UPS AND WORK TO REDUCE THE BACK LOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP.  A KEY ELEMENT OF COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT WILL BE TO FOCUS ON PROVIDING INFORMATION IN WAYS THAT UNDERSTANDABLE TO VARIOUS COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES OF THE AGREEMENT INCLUDE MAINTAINING A MASTER LEDGER OF ALL LUST TRUST FUND PROGRAM EXPENDITURES, LUST TRUST FUND PROGRAM RECOVERIES, SUBMITTING ANNUAL REPORTS, AND REPORTING SPECIFIC SITE LOCATIONS. THE STATE WILL INVESTIGATE, EVALUATE, AND DETERMINE THE CAUSE OF RELEASES CONDUCTED UNDER STATE LEAD. THE AGREEMENT WILL CONTINUE TO EVALUATE HOW INFORMATION IS DELIVERED TO COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS AND LOOK FOR OPPORTUNITIES TO INCREASE INFORMATION SHARING AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES: THESE AGREEMENT WORKPLAN TASKS PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT AND THE RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA BY CLEANING UP PETROLEUM AND HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE RELEASES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO'S LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PROGRAM.  SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ITS LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM, WHICH INCLUDES ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND ENFORCEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES.  

THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE LUST CORRECTIVE PROGRAM ARE TO INVESTIGATE SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES AND TO PERFORM CORRECTIVE ACTION ON THESE RELEASES. THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO WILL PROVIDE INVESTIGATIONS, EMERGENCY RESPONSES, REMEDIATION, RISK ASSESSMENT, ALTERNATIVE WATER SUPPLIES AND RELOCATION OF RESIDENTS AT SITES WHERE THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY IS UNKNOWN, OR UNWILLING, UNABLE TO RESPOND OR EMINENT DANGER TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. ACTIVITIES:MAJOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INVESTIGATING SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES, OVERSEEING AND ENFORCING CORRECTIVE ACTION BY OWNERS OR OPERATORS, AND PERFORMING DIRECT CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES WHEN THOSE OWNERS OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, OR UNABLE TO PERFORM THOSE ACTIVITIES THEMSELVES.  THE PROGRAM ELEMENTS IN THE 2024 LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) CORRECTIVE ACTION GRANTS PROGRAM ARE THOSE ACTIVITIES NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT THE STATE'S LUST TRUST FUND RESPONSE PROGRAM.  THOSE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE (1) COORDINATE AND PERFORM ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND STAFF WORK NECESSARY FOR RESPONDING TO RELEASES ACCORDING TO EPA'S GUIDELINES; (2) BE RESPONSIBLE FOR A SPECIFIC NUMBER OF CLEANUPS COMPLETED; (3) OVERSEE ALL UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) RELEASES/CLEANUPS WITH THE INTENT OF INCREASING THE PACE AT WHICH THEY ARE INITIATED AND COMPLETED; (4) PROVIDE END-OF-YEAR EVALUATION OF THE STATE'S PERFORMANCE IN ADMINISTERING THE LUST GRANT; (5) WORK TO INTEGRATE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONSIDERATIONS INTO UST/LUST PROGRAMS AND PROGRAMMATIC DECISIONS.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS THE STATE CLEANUP DATA THAT IS ENTERED INTO THE SEMI ANNUAL ACTIVITIES REPORT (LUST4) SYSTEM.  THE PRIMARY OUTCOME IS A REDUCTION IN THE BACKLOG OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) RELEASES FOR WHICH CLEANUPS HAVE NOT YET BEEN COMPLETED.  THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM.  

THE STATE WILL ALSO COMPLETE AND SUBMIT RESPONSE TO EPA SELF- ASSESSMENT QUESTIONNAIRE; PROVIDE INFORMATION THROUGH INTERVIEWS, FILE REVIEWS, AND DATA ANALYSIS TO ASSIST EPA IN THE COMPLETION OF THE REGIONAL PROGRAM OVERVIEW; AND SUBMIT AN UPDATED QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN AND THE QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS 60 DAYS PRIOR TO EXPIRATION OF CURRENT PLANS

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF ARKANSAS'S LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) PROGRAM.  SPECIFICALLY, THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR ITS LUST CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM, WHICH INCLUDES ASSESSMENT, REMEDIATION, AND ENFORCEMENT RELATED ACTIVITIES.  

THE MAIN OBJECTIVES OF THE LUST CORRECTIVE PROGRAM ARE TO INVESTIGATE SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES AND TO PERFORM CORRECTIVE ACTION ON THESE RELEASES.  THE STATE OF ARKANSAS WILL PROVIDE INVESTIGATIONS, EMERGENCY RESPONSES, REMEDIATION, RISK ASSESSMENT, ALTERNATIVE WATER SUPPLIES AND RELOCATION OF RESIDENTS AT SITES WHERE THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY IS UNKNOWN, OR UNWILLING, UNABLE TO RESPOND OR EMINENT DANGER TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. 
ACTIVITIES:MAJOR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE INVESTIGATING SUSPECTED PETROLEUM RELEASES, OVERSEEING AND ENFORCING CORRECTIVE ACTION BY OWNERS OR OPERATORS, AND PERFORMING DIRECT CORRECTIVE ACTION ACTIVITIES WHEN THOSE OWNERS OR OPERATORS ARE UNKNOWN, UNWILLING, OR UNABLE TO PERFORM THOSE ACTIVITIES THEMSELVES. THE PROGRAM ELEMENTS IN THE 2024 LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) CORRECTIVE ACTION GRANTS PROGRAM ARE THOSE ACTIVITIES NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT THE STATE'S LUST TRUST FUND RESPONSE PROGRAM.  THOSE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE (1) COORDINATE AND PERFORM ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND STAFF WORK NECESSARY FOR RESPONDING TO RELEASES ACCORDING TO EPA'S GUIDELINES; (2) BE RESPONSIBLE FOR A SPECIFIC NUMBER OF CLEANUPS COMPLETED; (3) OVERSEE ALL UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) RELEASES/CLEANUPS WITH THE INTENT OF INCREASING THE PACE AT WHICH THEY ARE INITIATED AND COMPLETED; (4) PROVIDE END-OF-YEAR EVALUATION OF THE STATE'S PERFORMANCE IN ADMINISTERING THE LUST GRANT; (5) WORK TO INTEGRATE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONSIDERATIONS INTO UST/LUST PROGRAMS AND PROGRAMMATIC DECISIONS.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLE IS THE STATE CLEANUP DATA THAT IS ENTERED INTO THE SEMI ANNUAL ACTIVITIES REPORT (LUST4 SYSTEM).  THE PRIMARY OUTCOME IS A REDUCTION IN THE BACKLOG OF UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) RELEASES FOR WHICH CLEANUPS HAVE NOT YET BEEN COMPLETED.  THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARY IS THE STATE CORRECTIVE ACTION PROGRAM.  

THE STATE WILL ALSO COMPLETE AND SUBMIT RESPONSE TO EPA SELF-ASSESSMENT QUESTIONNAIRE; PROVIDE INFORMATION THROUGH INTERVIEWS, FILE REVIEWS, AND DATA ANALYSIS TO ASSIST EPA IN THE COMPLETION OF THE REGIONAL PROGRAM OVERVIEW; AND SUBMIT AN UPDATED QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN AND THE QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS 60 DAYS PRIOR TO EXPIRATION OF CURRENT PLANS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF ARKANSAS IN DEVELOPING, IMPLEMENTING, AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (UST) PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT ACTIVITIES IN MAKING PROGRESS IN CLEANING UP PETROLEUM LEAKS BY INITIATING AND COMPLETING CLEANUPS, AND REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP. THE STATE OF ARKANSAS WILL PROVIDE INVESTIGATIONS, EMERGENCY RESPONSES, REMEDIATION, RISK ASSESSMENT, ALTERNATIVE WATER SUPPLIES AND RELOCATION OF RESIDENTS AT SITES WHERE THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY IS UNKNOWN, OR UNWILLING, UNABLE TO RESPOND OR EMINENT DANGER TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT. ACTIVITIES:THE PROGRAM ELEMENTS IN THE 2023 LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK CORRECTIVE ACTION GRANTS PROGRAM ARE THOSE ACTIVITIES NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT THE STATE'S LUST TRUST FUND RESPONSE PROGRAM.  THOSE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE (1) COORDINATE AND PERFORM ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND STAFF WORK NECESSARY FOR RESPONDING TO RELEASES ACCORDING TO EPA'S GUIDELINES; (2) BE RESPONSIBLE FOR A SPECIFIC NUMBER OF CLEANUPS COMPLETED SUCH THAT THE ACS MEASURES WILL BE MET; (3) OVERSEE ALL UST RELEASES/CLEANUPS WITH THE INTENT OF INCREASING THE PACE AT WHICH THEY ARE INITIATED AND COMPLETED; (4) PROVIDE END-OF-YEAR EVALUATION OF THE STATE'S PERFORMANCE IN ADMINISTERING THE LUST GRANT; (5) WORK TO INTEGRATE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE CONSIDERATIONS INTO UST/LUST PROGRAMS AND PROGRAMMATIC DECISIONS.  

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES TO EPA:  (1) STATE ACCURATELY REPORTS THE DATA NEEDED FOR THE SEMI-ANNUAL ACTIVITIES REPORT (LUST 4) IN A TIMELY MANNER; (2) STATE WILL COMPLETE AND SUBMIT RESPONSE TO EPA SELF- ASSESSMENT QUESTIONNAIRE; (3) STATE WILL PROVIDE INFORMATION THROUGH INTERVIEWS, FILE REVIEWS, AND DATA ANALYSIS TO ASSIST EPA IN THE COMPLETION OF THE REGIONAL PROGRAM OVERVIEW; AND (4) STATE WILL SUBMIT AN UPDATED QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN AND THE QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS 60 DAYS PRIOR TO EXPIRATION OF CURRENT PLANS

DESCRIPTION:THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING OF ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT (IDEM) IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS SITES WITHIN THE STATE OF INDIANA. PROMPT ACTION TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT PURSUIT OF COST RECOVERY OF LUST TRUST FUND. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIESAND IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LUST PROGRAMAND AND SUPPORTING ACTIVITIES IDENTIFYING SITES CONTAMINATED BY PETROLEUM RELEASES FROM UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS, OVERSEEING THE ASSESSMENT AND REMEDIATION OF SOILS AND GROUNDWATER AT THESE LUST SITES, OR TAKING AUTHORIZED CORRECTIVE ACTION TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM THESE RELEASES AND REDUCE THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP. PARTIAL AWARD.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FY 19 LEAKING UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANK (LUST) FUNDS TO THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION. THE FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES; IMPLEMENTING AND MAINTAINING AN EFFECTIVE LUST PROGRAM; AND SUPPORTING ACTIVITIES IDENTIFYING SITES CONTAMINATED BY PETROLEUM RELEASES FROM UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS, OVERSEEING THE ASSESSMENT AND REMEDIATION OF SOILS AND GROUNDWATER AT THESE LUST SITES, OR TAKING AUTHORIZED CORRECTIVE ACTION TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM THESE RELEASES AND REDUCE THE BACKLOG OF SITES NOT YET CLEANED UP.   PARTIAL AWARD.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE STATE OF MAINE FOR FEDERAL FISCAL YEARS 2017 AND 2018. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST THE STATE IN IDENTIFYING SITES CONTAMINATED BY PETROLEUM RELEASES FROM UNDERGROUND STORAGE TANKS AND IN OVERSEEING THE ASSESSMENT AND REMEDIATION OF SOILS AND GROUNDWATER AT THESE SITES (OR TO TAKE AUTHORIZED CORRECTIVE ACTION TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM THESE RELEASES).  THIS AWARD IS THE FY17 ALLOCATION.
